content.text:
I'm Claude Code, Anthropic's official CLI for Claude, and I'm ready to help you with your codebase exploration and file search tasks.

I'm currently in the `/Users/natedamstra/test-code/ui-design` directory, which is a git repository with an Astro project setup. Based on the git status, this is a new project with:
- Astro configuration
- TypeScript setup
- Package management (pnpm)
- Source directory structure

I'm equipped to:
- **Search files** using glob patterns and regex
- **Read and analyze** code contents
- **Navigate** your codebase efficiently
- **Report findings** with absolute file paths and code snippets

What would you like me to help you explore or search for in your project?

Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.

What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand.

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits".
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered.
- Don't include generic development practices.
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```
I'll analyze this codebase to understand its structure and create a comprehensive CLAUDE.md file.

file.content:
# Astro Starter Kit: Minimal

```sh
pnpm create astro@latest -- --template minimal
```

> üßë‚ÄçüöÄ **Seasoned astronaut?** Delete this file. Have fun!

## üöÄ Project Structure

Inside of your Astro project, you'll see the following folders and files:

```text
/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ public/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ pages/
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.astro
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
```

Astro looks for `.astro` or `.md` files in the `src/pages/` directory. Each page is exposed as a route based on its file name.

There's nothing special about `src/components/`, but that's where we like to put any Astro/React/Vue/Svelte/Preact components.

Any static assets, like images, can be placed in the `public/` directory.

## üßû Commands

All commands are run from the root of the project, from a terminal:

| Command                   | Action                                           |
| :------------------------ | :----------------------------------------------- |
| `pnpm install`             | Installs dependencies                            |
| `pnpm dev`             | Starts local dev server at `localhost:4321`      |
| `pnpm build`           | Build your production site to `./dist/`          |
| `pnpm preview`         | Preview your build locally, before deploying     |
| `pnpm astro ...`       | Run CLI commands like `astro add`, `astro check` |
| `pnpm astro -- --help` | Get help using the Astro CLI                     |

## üëÄ Want to learn more?

Feel free to check [our documentation](https://docs.astro.build) or jump into our [Discord server](https://astro.build/chat).

content.text: Now I'll create a focused CLAUDE.md file based on this minimal Astro + Vue + Tailwind setup:

input.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Tech Stack

- **Framework:** Astro 5.x with SSR capabilities
- **UI Library:** Vue 3.5+ with Composition API
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS 4.x (Vite plugin)
- **Package Manager:** pnpm
- **TypeScript:** Strict mode enabled (extends `astro/tsconfigs/strict`)

## Development Commands

```bash
pnpm install          # Install dependencies
pnpm dev              # Start dev server at localhost:4321
pnpm build            # Build production site to ./dist/
pnpm preview          # Preview production build locally
pnpm astro check      # Type-check project
```

## Project Architecture

### Build Configuration

- **Astro Config:** `astro.config.mjs` integrates Vue via `@astrojs/vue` and Tailwind via Vite plugin
- **Global Styles:** `src/styles/global.css` imports Tailwind CSS
- **TypeScript:** Strict type checking enabled, JSX set to "preserve" for Vue components

### File-Based Routing

- Pages in `src/pages/` are automatically routed by filename
- `.astro` files support both server-side and client-side rendering
- Vue components can be embedded in `.astro` pages with client directives (`client:load`, `client:visible`, etc.)

### Tailwind Integration

- Tailwind CSS 4.x integrated via `@tailwindcss/vite` plugin (not PostCSS)
- Global styles imported in `src/styles/global.css`
- No configuration file needed for basic setup (v4 uses CSS-based config)

## Component Patterns

### Vue in Astro

When creating Vue components:
- Use `<script setup lang="ts">` syntax
- Import into `.astro` pages and specify client hydration strategy
- Server-render by default unless client directive specified

### SSR Considerations

- Code in `.astro` files runs on the server during build/SSR
- Vue components are islands that hydrate on client based on directives
- Access to browser APIs requires `client:*` directives or `onMounted` lifecycle

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Tech Stack

- **Framework:** Astro 5.x with SSR capabilities
- **UI Library:** Vue 3.5+ with Composition API
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS 4.x (Vite plugin)
- **Package Manager:** pnpm
- **TypeScript:** Strict mode enabled (extends `astro/tsconfigs/strict`)

## Development Commands

```bash
pnpm install          # Install dependencies
pnpm dev              # Start dev server at localhost:4321
pnpm build            # Build production site to ./dist/
pnpm preview          # Preview production build locally
pnpm astro check      # Type-check project
```

## Project Architecture

### Build Configuration

- **Astro Config:** `astro.config.mjs` integrates Vue via `@astrojs/vue` and Tailwind via Vite plugin
- **Global Styles:** `src/styles/global.css` imports Tailwind CSS
- **TypeScript:** Strict type checking enabled, JSX set to "preserve" for Vue components

### File-Based Routing

- Pages in `src/pages/` are automatically routed by filename
- `.astro` files support both server-side and client-side rendering
- Vue components can be embedded in `.astro` pages with client directives (`client:load`, `client:visible`, etc.)

### Tailwind Integration

- Tailwind CSS 4.x integrated via `@tailwindcss/vite` plugin (not PostCSS)
- Global styles imported in `src/styles/global.css`
- No configuration file needed for basic setup (v4 uses CSS-based config)

## Component Patterns

### Vue in Astro

When creating Vue components:
- Use `<script setup lang="ts">` syntax
- Import into `.astro` pages and specify client hydration strategy
- Server-render by default unless client directive specified

### SSR Considerations

- Code in `.astro` files runs on the server during build/SSR
- Vue components are islands that hydrate on client based on directives
- Access to browser APIs requires `client:*` directives or `onMounted` lifecycle

content.text:
Created CLAUDE.md for this Astro + Vue + Tailwind CSS project. The file includes:

**Key sections:**
- Tech stack (Astro 5.x, Vue 3.5+, Tailwind CSS 4.x)
- Development commands (dev, build, preview, type-check)
- Build configuration details (Vite-based Tailwind integration)
- File-based routing patterns
- Component architecture (Vue islands in Astro pages)
- SSR considerations for proper hydration

The file focuses on the specific architectural decisions like:
- Tailwind v4 using Vite plugin (not PostCSS)
- Vue integration via `@astrojs/vue`
- Client directives for Vue component hydration
- TypeScript strict mode configuration
